abstract: Supreme Court rules that Nigerian plaintiffs who said foreign oil companies Royal Dutch Petroleum and Shell Transport and Trading Co had been complicit in violating their human rights may not sue in American courts; decision limits sweep of 1798 law that had been used to address human rights abuses abroad.
